adjective.description: (of farmland) plowed and harrowed but left unsown for a period in order to restore its fertility as part of a crop rotation or to avoid surplus production.
examples: incentives for farmers to let the land lie fallow in order to reduce grain surpluses

noun.description: A piece of fallow or uncultivated land.

origin: Old English falu, fealu, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch vaal and German fahl, falb.
